alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 22 at 10:43AM MST until February 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Carbon County including Baggs, Rawlins, Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, Saratoga, and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...Winter Storm Warning ends at 11 AM MST this morning. Wind Chill Warning from 5 PM MST today until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Another round of light snow is possible late Tuesday night through Wednesday. Additional accumulations of 1 to 3 inches will be possible.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
